poem:
**In the Margin of America**

Beneath the wooden folds,  
the silent men in dark  
echo the horse-drawn  
rhythms of their land.  
Outside, the full throat  
of power promises more  
worlds on fire;  
yet here, the language  
of barns whispers still,  
an unpolluted prayer,  
holding questions  
no rally can answer.
